fields.description:
Upgrade from 4.1.2 to 4.2.0 failed.

!http://mashable.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/Star-Trek.gif!

Original setup was running 4.1.2 with managed-novlan networking mode, walrus objectstore and das blockstore. Had a few instances (including 1 stopped) some volumes attached to each instance and EIP associations. After stopping all services on each host and upgrading to latest packages, starting the CLC for the first time resulted in DB upgrade failed.

Topology:
\[CLC WS CC\]
\[UFS\]
\[NC\]

{code}
[root@g-15-11 ~]# service eucalyptus-cloud start
Starting Eucalyptus services: Attempting database upgrade from 4.1.2 at /var/lib/eucalyptus/upgrade/eucalyptus.backup.1444364906...

Looks like this is the error:
{{ERROR | org.hibernate.PersistentObjectException: detached entity passed to persist: com.eucalyptus.compute.common.internal.network.PrivateNetwokIndex}}

comments.body:
[~sjones] Would you review the fix? 
git show 8a880d34b3f6d3a28be0aa1f4482da5cd773efd5

Before the upgrade, there was 3 instances, 2 in running and 1 in stopped. After upgrade, the metadata_addresses table contains 3 records that corresponds to the public IP of the 3 VMs. The running VM's IPs are in assigned state and the stopped VM in allocated state.
[~spark], the fix looks good. The state sounds OK assuming the IP in the allocated state was an elastic IP.

[~tony] [~sjones] After the fix is applied, the upgrade ran to completion. However I'm seeing other issues. There is no address available in the cloud and when I attempt to run an instance, this is the error logged in CLC:

{noformat}
Fri Oct 9 17:56:48 2015 ERROR [VmControl:EucalyptusRequestQueue.05] java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException
java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy151.describeFeatures(Unknown Source)
        at com.eucalyptus.network.DispatchingNetworkingService.describeFeatures(DispatchingNetworkingService.groovy)
        at com.eucalyptus.compute.common.network.Networking.describeFeatures(Networking.groovy:48)
        at com.eucalyptus.cloud.VmInstanceLifecycleHelpers$VpcNetworkInterfaceVmInstanceLifecycleHelper.verifyAllocation(VmInstanceLifecycleHelpers.groovy:764)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
        at com.eucalyptus.cloud.VmInstanceLifecycleHelpers$_DispatchingVmInstanceLifecycleHelper_closure1_closure3.doCall(VmInstanceLifecycleHelpers.groovy:145)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
...
...

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Networking not initialized
        at com.eucalyptus.network.DispatchingNetworkingService$__clinit__closure4.doCall(DispatchingNetworkingService.groovy:46)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor264.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
        at org.codehaus.groovy.reflection.CachedMethod.invoke(CachedMethod.java:90)
        at groovy.lang.MetaMethod.doMethodInvoke(MetaMethod.java:233)
        at groovy.lang.MetaClassImpl.invokeMethod(MetaClassImpl.java:1085)
        at groovy.lang.ExpandoMetaClass.invokeMethod(ExpandoMetaClass.java:1110)
        at groovy.lang.MetaClassImpl.invokeMethod(MetaClassImpl.java:909)
        at groovy.lang.Closure.call(Closure.java:423)
        at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.ConvertedClosure.invokeCustom(ConvertedClosure.java:51)
        at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.ConversionHandler.invoke(ConversionHandler.java:81)
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy88.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy151.describeFeatures(Unknown Source)
        ... 532 more

{noformat}

In CC, this is ERROR log:
{noformat}
2015-10-09 18:00:53 DEBUG 000003041 gni_populate             | begin parsing XML into data structures
2015-10-09 18:00:53 DEBUG 000003041 gni_populate             | end parsing XML into data structures
2015-10-09 18:00:53  WARN 000003041 gni_netmode_validate     | invalid network mode ''
2015-10-09 18:00:53  WARN 000003041 gni_validate             | Invalid network mode provided: cannot validate XML
2015-10-09 18:00:53 ERROR 000003041 gni_populate             | could not validate GNI after XML parse: check network config

{noformat}
[~spark], managed mode configuration uses the same approach as edge/vpcmido modes for 4.2 and the configuration migration is manual.

The necessary configuration is covered here:

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/~chuck/Next+Generation+Network+Driver#NextGenerationNetworkDriver-GeneratingtheMANAGEDandMANAGED-NOVLANJSONNetworkConfigurationString
[~tony] The fix is pushed to master. I didn't test the manual upgrade process that is explained in the link above.

Fix Verified.

Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.2.0
Release     : 0.0.24027.708.20151012gitd90b229.el6

Upgrade manged-novlan cloud from 4.1.2 -> 4.2.0 with stopped and running instances EIP associations, volume attachments etc was successful. This verification is that the DB upgraded successfully. Network config is being done separately and any issues with that will be new tickets.
